summary: All static analysis checks passed. The project is well-structured and ready to build and run.

checks.details: pyproject.toml is valid and properly configured with correct dependencies.
main.py exists and contains a proper main() function with if __name__ == '__main__' guard.
pygame-ce>=2.5.0 is correctly specified. Python version requirement (>=3.12) is appropriate.
No syntax errors detected. All imports are valid (pygame, sys, random, typing).
Well-organized class-based architecture with clear separation of concerns (Game, Player, Alien, Bullet, Vector classes).
All game rules from appinfo.json are correctly implemented (PLAYER_SPEED=5, BULLET_SPEED=7, etc.).
Proper pygame initialization and cleanup (pygame.quit(), sys.exit()).
Complete keyboard input handling for movement, shooting, and game controls (ESC, R, SPACE).
Proper colliderect usage for all collision scenarios (bullets vs aliens, bullets vs player, aliens vs player).
Standard game loop pattern with handle_input(), update(), draw() and FPS control.
Proper pygame display setup with caption, screen mode, and clock initialization.
No external asset files required. All graphics are drawn procedurally using pygame primitives.
Type hints are properly used throughout the code (typing.List, typing.Tuple, typing.Optional).
how_to_start command 'uv run main.py' matches the actual entry point file.
Code structure supports the documented observation space and action space for AI training.

recommendations.message: The .venv directory already exists, indicating dependencies may already be installed.
No external assets (images, sounds) required - pure procedural graphics generation.

build_command: uv venv && uv pip install pygame-ce
